description: A domestic dispute between a couple in Norfolk, Virginia, resulted in the fatal shooting of a K-9 officer named Krijger, who was struck by a bullet when a suspect opened fire on police.
title: Virginia police dog shot dead during standoff with gun shop salesman
title_page: Virginia police dog shot dead during standoff with gun shop salesman | Daily Mail Online
text:
A Virginia police dog was gunned down in the line of duty during a seven-hour standoff with an armed suspect who was then shot by responding officers.
Norfolk police were called to a residence in the 1100 block of Land Street to investigate a report of a domestic dispute at around 6pm Sunday. A woman escaped from the home while her husband, identified as 58-year-old Keith Richardson, remained barricaded inside with a gun.
According to a press release, Richardson refused orders to put the firearm down and surrender.
Scroll down for video
Rest in peace: A Virginia police dog named Krijger was shot dead during a standoff with an armed suspect in Norfolk
A gun shop salesman identified as 58-year-old Keith Richardson barricaded himself inside his house on Land Street in Norfolk after a dispute with his wife, sparking a seven-hour standoff with police
Police say after the armed man shot the K-9 officer, cops returned fire, wounding the suspect
After seven hours of failed negotiations, the armed man emerged from the residence brandishing a gun and opened fire, striking a K-9 dog named Krijger, according to officials.
Officers returned fire and shot Richardson, a salesman at a local gun shop, who was taken to Sentara Norfolk General Hospital with serious injuries, reported the stationWAVY.
Krijger, a Belgian Malinois whose name means 'Warrior' in Dutch, was rushed to a veterinary clinic where he was later pronounced dead.
The four-legged officer was four years old and had been with the Norfolk PD's K-9 unit for three years.
'Krijger was a dedicated and loyal member of the K9 Unit and will be missed by his handler and the men and women of the Norfolk Police Department,' police said in a statement Monday.
Police say they have obtained warrants charging Richardson with abduction, robbery and weapon counts.
